result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kirk P Myerson

records.addlTxt: Order for Defendants Appearance at Department of Corrections for Pre-Sentence Investigation Report.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kirk P Myerson in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Kirk P Myerson. Amended complaint filed. Defendant pleads guilty to Count #4. Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights filed. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and adjudges defendant guilty. Court gives WARNINGS regarding deportation, felon prohibited from firearm possession pursuant to Sec. 941.29, ineligibility to vote until civil rights restored, prohibition of child offender working with children pursuant to Sec. 948.13 and possession of body armor prohibited pursuant to Sec. 941.291.  Upon motion of the State remaining counts will be dismissed and read-in with prejudice. Court grants motion. PSI ordered. Minutes filed.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kirk P Myerson not in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Kirk P Myerson. Defendant has covid symptoms. Minutes filed.
Plea hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kirk P Myerson not in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Kirk P Myerson. Defendant is ill. Appearance waived. Parties are close to resolution. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kirk P Myerson in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Kirk P Myerson. Attorney has offer. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money
Signed bond filed with the court.
Original Bond filed with Court.  Defendant refused to sign bond.
see signature bond for conditions

MUST BE CO-SIGNED BY KYLE MYERSON
MUST POST $2,000 CASH.
NO ALCOHOL IN THE RESIDENCE. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.K.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kirk P Myerson appeared in court, in custody by video, Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger appeared in court for Kirk P Myerson. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Motion to modify bond by Defense. State objects to bond motion. Defendant's brother present in court and responds to Court's questions. Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Invocation of Right to Counsel
Affidavit in Support of Motion to Modify Conditions of Bond
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: with Exhibit #1 attached.

3:01 PM (64-06)Defendant Kirk P Myerson appeared in court, in custody via video with Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger appeared in court for Kirk P Myerson, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin Zeke Wiedenfeld appeared in court. 
State called to the stand as a witness, Lt. Steven Bapper.
Steven Bapper duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination of DA Wiedenfeld. Witness identified the defendant on the video.
Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed. Exhibit #1 offered and received by the court.
Exhibit #1 offered.
3:04 PM - Cross examination by Attorney Lettenberger.
Evidence is closed.
3:10 PM - Argument by DA Wiedenfeld.
3:11 PM - Argument by Attorney Lettenberger.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges. 


Adj. 3:15 PM

The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.K. Defendant Kirk P Myerson in court, in custody with attorney Jenna Proudfit for attorney Tony Kim specially.  Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
